page.title: 20ATTITUDES, GRAINTHORPE
page.content: The children interviewed a cross section of the villagers. {LIKED}"the peace and quiet;no dirty factories or city bustle;the space;the view of the Wolds;the kind,friendly, sociable and homely atmosphere. {BIGGEST CHANGES}"fields now covered with buildings,many newcomers,the new playing fields,the school's swimming pool,large hedgerows cut down,the first tractors,the coming of electricity,farmers making superfields by joining small ones,the loss of a pub and many small cottages". {WOULD LIKE TO SEE }"more jobs keeping people here,more facilities,more leisure time activities,a fish shop, a village green,more buses,no more changes,and more houses and newly weds wanting children to keep village life alive".
